parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Specify which provider to use. The project's provider priority list is used by default if no providers are selected. (Priority list can be managed on Uniblock's dashboard)

200.description: Standard JSON-RPC response format. Please check the result/error object field to determine if it`s successful or not.

post.description: Returns a list of addresses owned by client.

parameters.name: chainId
parameters.description: Unique identifier for a blockchain network.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: Specify which provider to use. The project's provider priority list is used by default if no providers are selected. (Priority list can be managed on Uniblock's dashboard)

200.description: Standard JSON-RPC response format. Please check the result/error object field to determine if it`s successful or not.

info.title: Bitcoin JSON RPC
info.description: These are the JSON RPC Methods supported by Bitcoin and providers.

ApiKeyAuth.name: X-API-KEY
ApiKeyAuth.description: API key to access the API (Optional)

id.description: An identifier established by the Client.

jsonrpc.description: The version of the JSON-RPC protocol.

method.description: A String containing the name of the method to be invoked.

params.description: A Structured value that holds the parameter values to be used during the invocation of the method.

from.description: 20 Bytes - The address the transaction is sent from.

to.description: 20 Bytes - The address the transaction is directed to. (Optional when creating new contract)

gas.description: Quantity - (optional) Integer of the gas provided for the transaction execution. (eth_call consumes zero gas)

gasPrice.description: Quantity - (optional) Integer of the gas price used for each paid gas.

value.description: Quantity - (optional) Integer of the value sent with this transaction.

data.description: Data - (optional) 4 byte hash of the method signature followed by encoded parameters.

nonce.description: Quantity - (optional) Integer of a nonce. This allows you to overwrite your own pending transactions that use the same nonce.

type.description: Transaction type (EIP-2930). Fixed value "0x1" for accessList transactions.

accessList.description: List of objects specifying the address (20 Bytes) and storageKeys (32 Byte items) that will be accessed.

storageKeys.description: List of storage keys, each 32 Bytes in length.

condition.description: Conditional submission of the transaction. Can be an object with a block number ({ block: 1 }), a UTC timestamp in seconds ({ time: 1491290692 }), or null.

blockHash.description: 32 Bytes - hash of the block where this transaction was included. Null when pending.

blockNumber.description: Block number where this transaction was included. Null when pending.

transactionIndex.description: The transaction's index position in the block. Null when pending.

input.description: The data sent along with the transaction.

v.description: The standardised V field of the signature.

standardV.description: The standardised V field of the signature (0 or 1). Only applicable to legacy transactions.

r.description: The R field of the signature.

chainId.description: The chain id of the transaction, if any.

contractAddress.description: 20 Bytes - The contract address created, if the transaction was a contract creation. Null otherwise.

cumulativeGasUsed.description: The total amount of gas used when this transaction was executed in the block.

gasUsed.description: The amount of gas used by this specific transaction alone.

logs.description: Array of log objects generated by this transaction. Each log contains indexed topics and data.

address.description: Address from which this log originated.

removed.description: Indicates whether this log was removed due to a chain reorg.

logsBloom.description: 256 Bytes - Bloom filter for logs/events generated during transaction execution.

root.description: 32 Bytes - Merkle root of the state trie after the transaction (optional after Byzantium).

status.description: 0x0 indicates failure, 0x1 indicates success. Set for blocks after Byzantium, null before.

defaultBlock.description: Block identifier. Can be an integer block number or a string tag: "latest", "earliest", or "pending".

allOf.description: AccessList transaction (EIP-2930). Extends LegacyTransaction but omits standardV.

filterId.description: The filter ID as a hex quantity (e.g., "0x16" for 22).

filterObject.description: Filter options used to create a new filter for logs. Topics are order-dependent. Nulls or nested arrays are used to match multiple possibilities.

topics.description: Array of up to 4 topic filters. Topics are order-dependent. Use null to match any topic or a sub-array to match one of many.

oneOf.description: Matches any topic in this position.
Matches one of the included topics at this position (logical OR).

limit.description: The maximum number of entries to retrieve (latest first).

receipt.description: Receipt object returned after transaction execution. Can be a legacy receipt (pre-EIP-2718) or AccessList receipt (EIP-2930).

legacyReceipt.description: Legacy transaction receipt (pre-EIP-2718). Includes basic execution result and log data.

allOf.description: AccessList receipt (EIP-2930). Extends legacy receipt and adds `type: 0x1`.

type.description: Receipt type. Fixed to "0x1" for EIP-2930 access list receipts.

filter.description: Filter options used to create a new log filter.

oneOf.description: List of contract addresses to filter logs from.

address.description: Contract address or list of addresses for filtering logs.

topics.description: Array of up to 4 topic filters. Each topic can be null, a 32-byte topic string, or an array of such strings.

oneOf.description: null - Matches any topic in this position.
Matches one of several possible topics at this position.

quantity.description: The maximum number of entries to retrieve.

traceTypes.description: Types of traces to collect: "vmTrace", "trace", and/or "stateDiff".

action.description: Details of the action performed (e.g., call, create, suicide).

callType.description: Type of call (e.g., call, delegatecall, staticcall, etc.).

input.description: Input data sent along with the call.

result.description: Result of the action (if successful).

subtraces.description: Number of nested trace steps inside this one.

traceAddress.description: Path to this trace in nested trace structure.

type.description: Type of trace (e.g., call, create, suicide).

error.description: Error message if the trace step failed.

traceCall.description: A trace call consisting of a transaction object and an array of trace types.

gas.description: Gas provided for the action (hex string).

input.description: Input data for the action (hex string).

blockHash.description: Hash of the block in which this trace occurred.

blockNumber.description: Block number in which this trace occurred.

result.description: Result of the trace action.

gasUsed.description: Gas used during this action (hex string).

subtraces.description: Number of nested trace steps inside this trace.

traceAddress.description: Path to this trace in the nested trace structure.

transactionHash.description: Hash of the transaction this trace belongs to.

transactionPosition.description: Index position of the transaction within the block.

trace.description: A single trace object representing an execution step in a transaction trace.

gas.description: Gas provided for the action (hex string).

input.description: Input data for the action (hex string).

blockHash.description: Hash of the block in which this trace occurred.

blockNumber.description: Block number in which this trace occurred.

result.description: Result of the trace action.

gasUsed.description: Gas used during this action (hex string).

subtraces.description: Number of nested trace steps inside this trace.

traceAddress.description: Path to this trace in the nested trace structure.

transactionHash.description: Hash of the transaction this trace belongs to.

transactionPosition.description: Index position of the transaction within the block.

error.description: Error message if the trace step failed.

traceConfig.description: Optional configuration object passed to tracing RPC methods.

tracer.description: Name of the built-in tracer or a JavaScript expression defining a custom tracer. If omitted, the default "opcode" tracer is used.

tracerConfig.description: JSON-formatted string with configuration options for the specified tracer.

timeout.description: Overrides the default 5s timeout for transaction tracing. Format follows Go duration strings (e.g., "10s", "500ms").

reexec.description: Number of blocks the tracer is willing to go back to re-execute and recover missing historical state (default = 128).

debug.description: Print output during capture end (default = false).

limit.description: Maximum number of steps to capture (default = 0, meaning no limit).

txIdx.description: Index of the transaction within the block.

keyStart.description: Starting key (32-byte hex string) used for filtering storage or entries.

maxResult.description: Maximum number of results to return.

pageSize.description: The page size for the number of results to return.

prove.description: To include proofs into the response.

pubkey.description: Base-58 encoded public key of the account to query.

slot.description: Slot number of the block to retrieve.

startSlot.description: Starting slot number for the range.

endSlot.description: Ending slot number for the range.

limit.description: Maximum number of results to return.

blockIdObj.description: BlockID object containing hash and number.

l1Block.description: L1BlockRef object with hash, number, parentHash, and timestamp.

l2Block.description: L2BlockRef object with hash, number, parentHash, timestamp, l1origin, and sequenceNumber.

sequenceNumber.description: Distance to first block of epoch (QUANTITY, 64 Bits).

syncStatus.description: Snapshot of rollup driver sync status.

chain_id.description: Chain ID where the transaction is sent (FieldElement).

class_hash.description: Hash of the desired account class (FieldElement).

contract_address_salt.description: Random salt that determines the account address (FieldElement).

resource_bounds.description: Mapping of resource type to resource bounds for fee market. Keys are "L1_GAS", "L1_DATA", "L2_GAS".

max_amount.description: Max amount of the resource allowed (FieldElement).

max_price_per_unit.description: Max price per unit the user is willing to pay (FieldElement). Prices in fri (1 fri = 10^-18 STRK).

chain_id.description: Chain ID where the transaction is sent (FieldElement).

compiled_class_hash.description: Hash of the compiled contract class (FieldElement).

resource_bounds.description: Mapping of resource type to resource bounds for fee market. Keys are "L1_GAS", "L1_DATA", "L2_GAS".

max_amount.description: Max amount of the resource allowed (FieldElement).

max_price_per_unit.description: Max price per unit willing to pay (FieldElement).

sender_address.description: Address of the account initiating the transaction (FieldElement).

max_price_per_unit.description: Max price willing to pay per unit

totalBalance.description: Total balance formatted as uint128 string

bcs.description: Move object content or package content in BCS. Only present if SuiObjectDataOptions.showBcs is true.

content.description: Move object content or package content. Only present if SuiObjectDataOptions.showContent is true.

digest.description: Base64 string representing the object digest

display.description: Display metadata for frontend UI rendering, or null if no Display is defined

owner.description: The owner of this object. Optional unless showOwner is enabled

previousTransaction.description: Digest of the last transaction that modified this object

storageRebate.description: Amount of SUI rebated if the object is deleted (uint64 as string)

type.description: Type of the object, if known

validator.description: The Sui address of the validator receiving the stake.

stake_amount.description: The amount staked (u64, as a string representing a BigInt).

suixValidatorApy.description: APY details for a specific validator.

oneOf.description: Optional flag to assume witness format when decoding.

result.description: Decoded transaction fields.
Decoded script information.
Fee rate estimates in BTC/kvB along with error details.
The EIP155 Chain ID, or null if not available.

oneOf.description: The filter ID as a hex quantity (e.g., "0x16" for 22).

result.description: Array of log objects, or an empty array if nothing has changed since last poll.

oneOf.description: The filter ID as a hex quantity (e.g., "0x16" for 22).

result.description: Array of log objects, or an empty array if nothing has changed since last poll.

oneOf.description: Sync status object returned while node is syncing.

startingBlock.description: The block number at which syncing started (hex string quantity).

blockGap.description: Array representing missing block range: [first, last).

warpChunksAmount.description: Total number of snapshot chunks to be processed.

warpChunksProcessed.description: Total number of snapshot chunks already processed.

oneOf.description: Returned when the node is not syncing.

result.description: Returns syncing status. Either a sync status object if syncing, or `false` if not syncing.

oneOf.description: The filter ID as a hex quantity (e.g., "0x16" for 22).

result.description: Boolean - true if the filter was successfully uninstalled, otherwise false.

oneOf.description: If false, return the header as hex instead of JSON.

result.description: Block header details or hex string depending on verbose flag.

oneOf.description: Optional list of metrics to compute.

result.description: Selected block statistics (size, weight, fees, etc.).
Chain tips with status, branch length, and block hash.

oneOf.description: Number of blocks in the window.

result.description: Statistics such as tx rate, fees, and block sizes.

Current network difficulty.

Memory statistics or malloc info depending on mode.

items.description: If true, return detailed objects rather than just txids.

result.description: Mempool transaction ids or verbose objects.

oneOf.description: If true, return decoded JSON instead of hex.

result.description: UTXO information or null if the output is spent.

oneOf.description: List of transaction ids to prove.

result.description: Hex-encoded proof data.

result.description: 32 Bytes - Hash of the transaction.

oneOf.description: Array of raw transaction hex strings.

result.description: Package acceptance results per transaction.

result.description: Validation results for each transaction candidate.

result.description: Estimated hashes per second.

result.description: Raw transaction hex string.

items.description: List of PSBT strings to merge.

result.description: Combined PSBT encoded as base64.

result.description: Derived addresses in string form.

items.description: Optional template request specifying capabilities and rules.

items.description: Maximum number of addresses to return.

result.description: Peer address records.

items.description: Optional command name to get detailed help for.

result.description: Human-readable help text.

items.description: List of log categories to include or exclude.
